page.title: 20MEMORY/OPINION IN N.PROSPECT
page.content: {We found that most Plymouth citizens were very happy living where they were and did not want to live anywhere else.The few people who had not lived {in Plymouth all their lives,moved here because of jobs (eg.In the Dockyard) or family.The majority of these people said they would like to return to {their home town.A large number of people remembered the Jubilee,Sir Francis Chichester's return from sailing around the World and the tall {ships race.The elderly people had memories of Plymouth surrounded by fields and forrests.The residents thought that there was a lot to do in {Plymouth,and that the shops were pleasant and convenient.The things that they disliked were the problems of vandalism and graffiti.In addition, {the older people did not like the new buildings,and the new estates.
